keyword: calories in 4 oz of ground beef
title: Calories in 4 oz of Ground Beef
meta_description: Learn the calories in 4 oz of ground beef, with a full nutrition profile including protein, fat, carbs, and variations for different leanness levels.
h1: Calories in 4 oz of Ground Beef
assumptions: 80% lean ground beef, pan-broiled (cooked), drained of excess fat; no added salt, seasonings, or binders; 4 oz = 113 g cooked weight.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by leanness (e.g., 70/30 vs. 90/10), cooking method, draining, and brand; raw weight is higher due to moisture loss. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 4 oz of cooked 80% lean ground beef provides ~278 kcal and ~27 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp vegetable oil per 100 g during cooking

faqs.q: How many calories in 4 oz cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: About 278 kcal for 80% lean, pan-broiled and drained.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 4 oz ground beef?

faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain cooked ground beef.

faqs.q: How does leanness affect calories in ground beef?
faqs.a: Leaner (90%) has fewer calories (~176 kcal/100 g) vs. 80% lean (246 kcal/100 g); fattier increases them.

faqs.q: Are these values for raw or cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: Cooked; raw 4 oz would be ~200-250 kcal but shrinks to ~3 oz when cooked due to fat and water loss.
